catalog_info.title: Colonial Departures
catalog_info.description: Following World War II, the fabric of European empire in Asia and Africa began to unravel. Some through revolutionary violence, others through peaceful negotiation, new nations declared themselves free of colonial domination. We examine colonialism's 20th century heyday, decline, and aftermath from an anthropological perspective, giving particular attention to local decolonizing practices and to the many forms the postcolonial condition may take.
